pros: Supporting the Catholic Church and its core values.
cons: Very flat organization. Virtually no opportunity for upward mobility.

review_title: There are pros, but cons far outweigh...
pros: -Very pretty, beautiful campus. -They let you file for unemployment when they eliminate your job. -Lots of holidays and paid time off.
cons: -Poor Leadership -Diminished Catholic mission -Job insecurity -No cohesion between departments -Low pay -Low employee morale
I don't have many cons for this organization

pros:
Beautiful Campus
Mission-based, meaningful work to support future Catholic priests

Beautiful grounds, great atmosphere! People are nice and welcoming. There are lots of opportunities for learning that you are able to take full advantage of. One gets a great feeling of history while working here.
cons: There is not a lot of room for advancement here. It is a great place to be, however, so that's something to take into consideration. Personality clashes can happen, and so that is something to be navigated carefully.

pros: All people share a great deal of interesting in helping you succeed. It is continually about the mission and helping all to reach their goals.
cons: It is a University and very insulated. You will not find the usual drive of a business to get things completed on a schedule.

pros: Very flexible, I've never worked anywhere where I felt I was so appreciated and my strengths and talents were so well utilized!
cons: I had a fantastic boss and was well compensated for the work I did
